metadata.title: CVE-2024-0639 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A denial of service vulnerability due to a deadlock was found insctp_auto_asconf_init in net/sctp/socket.c in the Linux kernelâ€™s SCTPsubsystem. This flaw allows guests with local user privileges to trigger adeadlock and potentially crash the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-0639` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
